newsitem.title: UK: U.K. Intervention Board details EU sugar sales.
newsitem.headline: U.K. Intervention Board details EU sugar sales.

text.p: A total 30,300 tonnes of current series white sugar received export rebates of a maximum 44.471 European Currency Units (Ecus) per 100 kilos at Wednesday's European Union (EU) tender, the U.K. Intervention Board said.
Out of this, traders in France received 25,000 and in Germany 5,300 tonnes, it added.

This week's award brings the cumulative tonnage awarded for export from the 1996/97 crop to 1.563 million tonnes. This compares with the 2,250 tonnes awarded on February 28, 1996, when the cumulative tonnage totalled 1.601 million tonnes.
Earlier on Wednesday, London traders had expected the subsidy for the current season whites campaign for licences to end-July to be 44.471 Ecus per 100 kilos, the exact amount awarded.
Traders had also forecast the total authorised sugar tonnage export awards to be between 20,000 and 60,000 tonnes versus 17,000 last week when the restitution was 44.008 Ecus.
